MR Evo the review
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2006 Topics (Year of the Mercury Drop): MR Evo the review
By mwmj on Saturday, June 24, 2006 - 08:52 am:

Hey i thought i would write a quick review of the game itself for those people that are interested. Anyways....

Graphics 9/10
I like the graphics the monsters seem a little more like they are real and less cartoony (no offense to the MR games done in cell shading thier great too). Also the battle areas and the dungeons are very well done. Alot of attention was paid to details in alot of areas of the graphics in the game.

Music 9/10
The music is great I wouldn't think anything less of tecmo for one of the greatest series of games i have ever played. Tecmo doesn't disappoint in this game either. Victory music actually makes you feel like your monsters did win the battle and it is worth celebrating and other music in the game fits nicely with the theme of whats going on.

Replay Value 8/10
A lower Value because the tourneys aren't there so much but it still has great replay value after you get passed the thirty minute tutorial. Going on adventures make things a little more interesting but if there were more alternate routes to explore it would be even greater.

Overall Average 9/10
this game is great and if they really were to make MR6 (which doesn't seem to be likely based on information floating around) they could combine classic ranching with the ability to go dungeon diving instead of exploring. You could still find stuff and find rare combining items but also gain experience for the monster and possibly teach it new techs like in Evo. Put the Best of RPGs and the Best of Monster Rancher and you got a game Two sets of fans would play.

Thank you
Mystic Warrior MJ
